div.font: Schools are closed for the rest of the school year. Will life ever return to normal?
What is normal? Now is the time to create the new normal. In the meantime:

font.font: Wash your hands. Read, read, read. Post a YouTube video.
font.span: Pick up your room. Pick up the house. Pickup the yard. Wash the windows, inside and out. Pet the cat. Have a serious discussion with the dog, about your new life. Wave to everyone that goes past your house.

span.font: There really is a lot to do.
This week's Senior Spotlight is Cade Lawrence. Cade is a three-sport athlete (football, basketball and baseball). Remarkably, he has started in all three since his sophomore year.
This past football season Cade earned All-League and All-State as a defensive back. Cade is an outstanding student with a 3.77 GPA demonstrates. He is also a member of the Leadership Council.
Cade is an outstanding center fielder in baseball and would have undoubtedly earned all-league this year. In basketball, Cade was a lock-down defender who also could be called on to score.
Cade plans on attending Walla Walla Community College to become an electrician. Finally, he is one of the few guys who can sport a Mullet haircut and do it well!

p.span: Are the sad thoughts of tomorrow
You want to see in the world.
Six Feet Apart (song) - Luke Combs Eleanor Roosevelt quote

span.br: Due to the cancellation of the spring sport seasons and events, Onalaska will be recognizing and honoring our senior student-athletes for the rest of the school year.

font.span: who is the defending State 2B Shot Put Champion in track and field. Without a doubt she would have won it again. Carmen is a three-sport athlete (volleyball, basketball and track) and she excels in all three. She is the epitome of an outstanding student athlete.
. She is also a valuable member of the Leadership Council and is responsible for all the positive things that happen at Ony!
She is well respected by students and staff. Carmen will sign a letter of intent to compete and study a
. Carmen will be very successful in life. Best of Luck to her!
Thank you to all the faculty and staff who helped with the
event last Friday. Thank you to those who showed up to support the Class of 2020. A special shoutout to
or providing the great music - although a little short on disco! Likewise, thank you to
Finally, thanks to all the students, parents, and community members who came out to celebrate at safe social distancing distances.

i.a: Free Meals for Kids Request Form

div.font: For fishing season this year, the Onalaska High School Aquaculture Program will plant its very own homegrown Rainbow Trout Broodstock. We plan on releasing 70, 10lb and 300, 3.5lb Rainbow Trout the day before fishing season opens into Carlisle Lake. These fish have been raised by the Aquaculture students over the past 4 years.
The Aquaculture program is made possible by a generous grant given by TransAlta, continual support from the Chehalis Basin Fisheries Task Force, Weyerhaeuser, Bio-Oregon, and several others.
Please share with everyone you know so these fish will be caught before summer hits!

div.span: Parents and Guardians of Onalaska Students:
div.div: We have now been out of school for 25 days (excluding Spring Break). That is a lot of time away from our students. I imagine most of you, if not all of you, wish your children were in school... so do we!

The second wave of learning packets went out this week, using a "grab and go" protocol. Completed work should have been dropped off and new work picked up. If you were not able to get in to pick up or drop off work, please contact the school your child attends and make arrangements with them on how best to get the new work. Our staff will continue to contact students and parents, as well as continue to offer online learning opportunities for those with internet access. We have issued over 220 Chromebooks to our students, so I am hoping that will help with the distance learning issue.

Last week, I put out a request to our staff and community to raise some money to purchase food certificates for our families most impacted by this pandemic. As of this writing, we have had over $4700 donated! I am extremely impressed and proud of the generosity of our Onalaska family. We will begin getting those out to families next week and will continue to do so as long as the donations continue and we have the funds to do so. Thanks to all of you who have donated. You can still participate by mailing or dropping off money to the District Office at 540 Carlisle Ave., 98570. We did look into PayPal, but it wasn't going to work for us at this time, so mailing or dropping off is the best way to donate.

If you or your student have not communicated with your teacher(s), please contact the school your child attends and let them know. We have encouraged our staff to reach out often to students to check in, in addition to any online learning that is occurring via Google Classroom, DoJo, Zoom, or any other digital platform that teachers are using. This will be continuing through the remainder of the school year, so we need to keep those lines of communication open.

We have received guidance from OSPI, the Office of the Superintendent of Public Instruction, on grading procedures. I will send those out to you early next week. Please encourage your student to set aside time each day to work on their learning packets or to participate in online learning opportunities. This is not ideal, but it is the best way we have, so far, in making sure students keep up with learning and will be better prepared when they do come back to school in the Fall.

Please let me know if you have questions and I will do my best to get back to you with answers. The best advice I can provide at this point is to take care of yourselves and your families, and be patient. We are all in this together and need to support each other the best we can under these trying circumstances.

span.font: Don't miss out on our historical 2020 Onalaska High School Yearbook! Only a limited supply left as this edition will be one of a kind. Includes Fall and Winter Sports, Activities, Students, current events that impacted OHS, and much much more!

div.span: You may either mail in your $45 payment to: Onalaska High School Yearbook, 540 Carlisle Avenue, Onalaska, WA 98570 with Josten's order form, or purchase online at the following link:

b.span: In Honor of Our Logger Seniors

div.span: 8:20 (20:20) all high schools in Washington State are going to turn on their stadium lights to honor this year's Class of 2020. Onalaska Memorial Field lights will be shining bright...
Please respect the social distancing policy and, of course, be safe.

h3.font: The free meals being delivered to Ony students, do not make and deliver themselves. There is a dedicated crew behind the making and delivering of meals. The prep crew begins their day at 6:00 am.
Volunteers are working through spring break, many without pay, to make and deliver meals.

div.span: We appreciate and value these dedicated employees. Thank you.
